channel.title: Incoming and outgoing in non-Whonix workstation
channel.description: I want to run an application in non-Whonix Debian workstation. I've setup an onion address in Gateway and confirmed my application works (incoming and outgoing) in standard Whonix workstation. I need at least outgoing to work via the 9050 port. How do I forward this to Gateway in standard Debian? I would like incoming to work via the onion address established in Gateway if possible.

item.title: Incoming and outgoing in non-Whonix workstation
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
HulaHoop:

do you think any WS firewall changes would be needed?

sdjkk:

I want to run an application in non-Whonix Debian workstation.

Therefore there is no workstation firewall.

Read full topic

item.title: Incoming and outgoing in non-Whonix workstation
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Not sure the syntax. In Whonix https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Dev/anon-ws-disable-stacked-tor does that. socat something.

sudo apt install socat

sudo socat TCP-LISTEN:9050,fork,bind=127.0.0.1 TCP:10.152.152.10:9050

Not a Whonix specific question as per https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Free_Support_Principle.

Read full topic
